title: BC-AP News Digest 3 am; BC-AP News Digest 3 am
body:
Here are the AP's latest coverage plans, top stories and promotable content. All times EDT. For up-to-the minute 
information on AP's coverage, visit Coverage Plan at https://newsroom.ap.org .

------------------

TOP STORIES

------------------

TRUMP-IMPEACHMENT-UKRAINE AMBASSADOR _ Former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine Marie Yovanovitch 
tells House impeachment investigators that President Trump pressured the State Department to oust her from her 
post and get her out of the country. By Mary Clare Jalonick, Matthew Lee and Alan Fram. SENT: 1,180 words, 
photos, video.

ELECTION 2020-DEMOCRATS _ Less than four months until voting begins, a Democratic presidential race that 
had been largely static through the summer has tumbled into a chaotic fall. Front-runners are facing urgent 
questions about their ability to take on President Donald Trump. Lower-tier candidates eager to challenge the top-
tier trio are struggling to rise above the din in Washington. By Julie Pace, Thomas Beaumont and Steve Peoples. 
SENT: 1,020 words, photos.

CALIFORNIA WILDFIRES _ Santa Ana winds that drove fires through two Southern California areas have died 
down but flames that destroyed dozens of homes continue to rage. A blaze in the San Fernando Valley area of Los 
Angeles was only 13% contained Saturday after destroying 13 buildings. One man who had tried to fight the blaze 
died of a heart attack. By Stefanie Dazio and Brian Melley. SENT: 1,030 words, photos, video.

CHINA-NATIONALISM BEATS NBA _ The patriotic fervour buoyed by Chinese companies suspending their NBA 
partnerships followed a celebration marking 70 years of Communist Party rule in China. President Xi Jinping has 
rallied the populace around the promise of a Chinese Dream and national rejuvenation. By Yanan Wang. SENT: 
1,200 words, photos. This story is this week's Sunday Spotlight.

CHINA-TRADE _ The Trump administration and China declared a temporary truce in their 15-month trade war. Yet 
the grievances that led them to impose tariffs on hundreds of billions of dollars of each other's goods remain largely 
unresolved. By Paul Wiseman and Kevin Freking. SENT: 1,060 words, photos, video. With CHINA-TRADE-THE 
LATEST.


-----------------------------------------

WHAT WE'RE TALKING ABOUT

-----------------------------------------

CALIFORNIA-SMOKING BAN-BEACHES _ California to ban smoking on state parks and beaches. SENT: 280 
words.

GM-STRIKE-UAW PROPOSAL _ UAW counters GM's offer in hopes of a deal. SENT: 140 words.

TRUMP-LITTLE LEAGUE _ Little League champs fly home to Louisiana with Trump. SENT: 110 words, photos.

---------------------------------

WASHINGTON/POLITICS

---------------------------------

ELECTION 2020-CONGRESS-SESSIONS _ Former Republican Rep. Pete Sessions' road back to Congress was 
already off to a rough start even before a federal indictment appearing to link him to a campaign finance scheme 
and the Ukraine scandal at the heart of the impeachment inquiry. By Paul J. Weber and Will Weissert. SENT: 1,010 
words, photos.

TRUMP-HOMELAND SECURITY SECRETARY _ Kevin McAleenan, a career civil servant who became the unlikely 
point man for President Trump's hardline immigration policies, is stepping down as acting Homeland Security 
secretary after six months on the job. McAleenan tells The Associated Press he is leaving on his own terms _ a 
contrast to other top administration officials pushed out during Trump's tenure. By Colleen Long. SENT: 990 words, 
photos.

PELOSI-TRUMP _ Speaker Nancy Pelosi says President Donald Trump has become a "potty-mouth," but that's not 
why House Democrats are pursuing impeachment. In a conference call, Pelosi told her House Democratic 
colleagues to stay focused on their "just the facts, ma'am," impeachment probe. SENT: 340 words, photo, video.

IMMIGRATION-PUBLIC-BENEFITS _ A federal judge in New York on Friday temporarily blocked President Donald 
Trump from implementing a plan to deny green cards to many immigrants who use Medicaid, food stamps and 
other government benefits. SENT: 810 words, photos.

----------------------

INTERNATIONAL

----------------------

ECUADOR _ A party clown entertains children. Indigenous Amazonians tote hand-carved spears. Masked men 
battle police. This is the field of the main battle for control of the economic future of Ecuador. SENT: 960 words, 
photos.

HAITI-POLITICAL-CRISIS _ Thousands of protesters clash with police as they looted stores and tried to break 
through a barricade leading toward the residence of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse in one of the biggest 
demonstrations in weeks to demand his resignation. The violence came a day after a journalist covering the 
demonstrations was fatally shot in his car. SENT: 640 words, photos.

ASIA-TYPHOON _ A heavy downpour and strong winds pounded Tokyo and surrounding areas as a powerful 
typhoon forecast as the worst in six decades approached landfall, with streets and train stations deserted and 
shops shuttered. SENT: 590 words, photos.



---------------

NATIONAL

---------------

IMMIGRATION-HUMANITARIAN FUNDS _ Federal officials begin to reimburse organizations that fed, sheltered 
and transported migrants released this year in American towns near the U.S.-Mexico border, according to 
Democratic lawmakers and some organizations receiving the funds. SENT: 940 words.

SERIAL KILLER INVESTIGATIONS _ After 37 years, a Tennessee mother has finally gotten closure about what 
happened to her daughter. Minnie Hill's daughter Rosie was just 19 when she was killed by Samuel Little while 
living as a single mother in Florida. Now that Little was named the deadliest serial killer in U.S. history this week - 
he's confessed to 92 slayings between 1970 and 2005 - Hill and victims' families around the country are reliving the 
trauma all over again. Police have confirmed 50 cases linked to Little, and the FBI has released disturbing video 
interviews of him, hoping to solve additional, long-forgotten cold cases. Serial killer experts say Little didn't confess 
out of the goodness of his heart. Still, Hill says she's forgiven Little. By Adrian Sainz. SENT: 910 words, photos.

AP EXPLAINS-CHRISTOPHER COLUMBUS _ The AP explains how a day celebrating Christopher Columbus went 
from an icon used by Italian immigrants to fight discrimination in the U.S. to a symbol of indigenous genocide by 
politicized Native American activists. By Russell Contreras. SENT: 820 words, photos.

-----------------------

HEALTH & SCIENCE

-----------------------

CALIFORNIA WILDFIRES-POWER SHUTDOWN-CLIMATE _ Expect more preventative power blackouts in 
California as the climate gets hotter and drier and the wildfire season gets nastier and longer, scientists say. The 
Golden State already is fire-prone with lots of dry plants and woodlands - but add high winds that can knock down 
power lines or cause them to spark, then watch out, wildfire experts say. By Science Writer Seth Borenstein. SENT: 
670 words, photos.

----------------------

ENTERTAINMENT

----------------------

OBIT-ROBERT FORSTER _ Robert Forster, the handsome and omnipresent character actor who got a career 
resurgence and Oscar-nomination for playing bail bondsman Max Cherry in "Jackie Brown," has died. He was 78. 
By Film Writer Lindsey Bahr. SENT: 750 words, photos.

POWER OF WOMEN LUNCHEON _ Jennifer Aniston, Ellen DeGeneres, Awkwafina and more stars overcame a 
dysfunctional teleprompter to toast one another and their charities at a women's luncheon in Beverly Hills. By Film 
Writer Lindsey Bahr. SENT: 740 words, photos.

MEDIA-FOX-SMITH _ Shepard Smith, whose newscast on Fox News Channel seemed increasingly an outlier on a 
network dominated by supporters of President Donald Trump, abruptly quit after signing off his final newscast on 
Friday. By Media Writer David Bauder. SENT: 640 words, photos.

JESSYE NORMAN-FUNERAL _ World-famous performers, civil rights leaders and people who know her good 
works are gathering for the funeral of international opera star Jessye Norman in her Georgia hometown. SENT: 500 
words, photos, video.

----------



SPORTS

----------

TOP STORIES

BBN--NLCS _ It turns out Washington's Big Three is a Big Four. Don't forget about Aníbal Sánchez. The right-
hander carried a no-hit bid into the eighth inning, Howie Kendrick had two more big swings and the Nationals beat 
the St. Louis Cardinals 2-0 in the NL Championship Series opener. By Sports Writer Jay Cohen. SENT: 930 words, 
photos
